source: Cela est dû au fait que le courant électrique qui circule dans la douille, où s'encastre la partie métallique de l'ampoule, peut entraîner des chocs électriques graves si vous entrez en contact avec son intérieur ou sa base métallique alors que l'ampoule est encore partiellement insérée dans la douille.
reference: This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.
translation: The reason is that the current that flows through the socket, where the metal part of the bulb sits, can cause serious electric shock if you touch the inside or base of the socket while the bulb is still partially in the socket.

source: L'organe principal du système cardio-vasculaire est le cœur, celui-ci pompe le sang.
reference: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood.
translation: French text: The main organ of the cardiovascular system is the heart, which pumps the blood.

source: Le sang s'éloigne du cœur dans des tubes appelés artères et revient au cœur dans des tubes appelés veines. Les plus petits tubes sont appelés capillaires.
reference: Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.
translation: French text: Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

source: Une dentition de tricératops aurait été capable d'écraser non seulement des feuilles, mais également des branches et des racines très dures.
reference: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots.
translation: French text: A tricératops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves, but also branches and roots very hard.

source: Certains scientifiques pensent que le tricératops mangeait des cycadées, un type de plante qui était très courant pendant la période crétacée.
reference: Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous.
translation: French: Certains scientifiques pensent que le tricératops mangeait des cycadées, un type de plante qui était très courant pendant la période crétacée.

source: Ces plantes ressemblent à un petit palmier avec une couronne de feuilles pointues et hérissées.
reference: These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves.
translation: French text: These plants look like a palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves.

source: Un tricératops aurait pu utiliser son bec puissant pour enlever les feuilles avant de manger le tronc.
reference: A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk.
translation: French text: A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to remove the leaves before eating the trunk.

source: D’autres scientifiques affirment que ces plantes sont très toxiques, il est donc peu probable qu’un dinosaure les ait mangées, même si aujourd’hui, le paresseux et d’autres animaux comme le perroquet (un descendant des dinosaures) peuvent manger des feuilles ou des fruits toxiques.
reference: Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.
translation: French: D’autres scientifiques affirment que ces plantes sont très toxiques, il est donc peu probable qu’un dinosaure les ait mangées, même si aujourd’hui, le paresseux et d’autres animaux comme le perroquet (un descendant des dinosaures) peuvent manger des feuilles ou des fruits toxiques.

source: Comment la gravité d’Io pourrait-elle m’affecter ? Si vous vous teniez sur la surface d’Io, vous pèseriez moins que sur Terre.
reference: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth.
translation: French text: How would Io's gravity affect me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth.

source: Une personne qui pèse 200 livres (90kg) sur Terre pèserait environ 36 livres (16kg) sur Io. Donc la gravité, bien sûr, vous attire moins.
reference: A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.
translation: French text: A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So gravity, of course, would pull you less.

source: Le Soleil ne possède pas de croûte comme la Terre sur laquelle on peut se tenir debout. Le Soleil tout entier est fait de gaz, de feu et de plasma.
reference: The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma.
translation: French text: The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth on which you can stand. The whole Sun is made of gases, fire, and plasma.

source: Le gaz se raréfie à mesure que l'on s'éloigne du centre du Soleil.
reference: The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun.
translation: French text: The gas becomes thinner as you move away from the center of the Sun.

source: La partie extérieure que nous voyons lorsque nous regardons le Soleil s’appelle la photosphère, ce qui signifie « boule de lumière ».
reference: The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means "ball of light".
translation: French text: The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphère, which means "bulb of light".

source: Environ trois mille ans plus tard, en 1610, l'astronome italien Galilée utilisa un télescope pour observer que Vénus a des phases, tout comme la lune.
reference: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does.
translation: French text: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does.

source: Des phases se produisent parce que seul le côté de Vénus (ou de la Lune) qui fait face au Soleil est éclairé. Les phases de Vénus ont justifié la théorie de Copernic selon laquelle les planètes tournent autour du Soleil.
reference: Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun.
translation: French text: Phases occur because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is illuminated. The phases of Venus supported the Copernican theory that planets orbit the Sun.

source: Puis, quelques années plus tard, en 1639, un astronome anglais du nom de Jeremiah Horrocks a observé un transit de Vénus.
reference: Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.
translation: Then, a few years later, in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

source: L'Angleterre avait connu une longue période de paix après la reconquête du Danelaw.
reference: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw.
translation: The English had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of Danelaw.

source: Cependant, en 991, Ethelred a dû faire face à une flotte viking plus importante que toutes les autres depuis celle de Guthrum un siècle plus tôt.
reference: However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier.
translation: However, in 991 Ethelred had to face a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier.

source: Cette flotte était commandée par Olaf Trygvasson, un Norvégien qui avait l'ambition de soustraire son pays à la domination danoise.
reference: This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination.
translation: The fleet was commanded by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian who wanted to free his country from Danish domination.

source: Après les premiers échecs militaires, Ethereld est parventu à un accord avec Olaf, pour sa part retourné en Norvège afin d'essayer de reconquérir son royaume, pour des résultats mitigés.
reference: After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.
translation: French text: After the first military setbacks, Ethelred was able to negotiate a peace with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to reclaim his kingdom, with mixed results.

source: Le Hangeul est le seul alphabet inventé exprès pour être utilisé dans la vie quotidienne. L'alphabet a été inventé en 1444 sous le règne du roi Sejong (1418 – 1450).
reference: Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450).
translation: Hangeul is the only alphabet invented specifically for everyday use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 under King Sejong (1418 – 1450).

source: Sejong le Grand fut le quatrième roi de la dynastie Joseon et demeure l’un des souverains coréens les plus respectés.
reference: King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded.
translation: French text: Sejong the Great was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most revered kings of Korea.

source: À l’origine, il a donné à l’alphabet Hangeul le nom de Hunmin Jeongeum, qui signifie « les sons corrects pour instruire le peuple ».
reference: He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means "the correct sounds for the instruction of the people".
translation: French text: At the beginning, he gave the Hangeul alphabet the name Hunmin Jeongeum, which means "the correct sounds to instruct the people".

source: Il existe de nombreuses théories sur la façon dont le sanskrit a vu le jour. L'une d'entre elles concerne une migration aryenne de l'ouest vers l'Inde qui est venue avec sa langue.
reference: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them.
translation: French text: There are many theories about how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west to India who brought their language with them.

source: Le sanskrit est une langue ancienne, celle-ci est comparable à la langue latine parlée en Europe.
reference: Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe.
translation: Sanskrit is an ancient language, comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe.

source: Le plus ancien livre connu du monde a été écrit en sanskrit. Après la compilation des Upanishads, le sanskrit s'est tout simplement effacé en raison de la hiérarchie
reference: The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy.
translation: French text: The oldest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just disappeared due to hierarchy.

source: Le sanskrit est une langue très complexe et très riche, qui a servi de source à de nombreuses langues indiennes modernes, tout comme le latin est la source de langues européennes telles que le français et l'espagnol.
reference: Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.
translation: Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which served as a source for many modern Indian languages, just as Latin is the source for European languages such as French and Spanish.

source: Une fois la bataille pour la France terminée, l'Allemagne a commencé à se préparer à envahir l'île de Grande-Bretagne.
reference: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain.
translation: French text: After the battle for France, Germany started to prepare to invade the island of Britain.

source: L’Allemagne a donné le nom de code « Opération Lion de Mer » à cette attaque. L’armée britannique avait perdu la majeure partie de son artillerie lourde et de ses munitions lors de l’évacuation de Dunkerque, et était donc assez affaiblie.
reference: Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak.
translation: French text: Germany gave the code name "Operation Lion of the Sea" to this attack. The British army had lost most of its heavy guns and ammunition during the evacuation of Dunkirk, so it was fairly weak.

source: Mais la Royal Navy était encore beaucoup plus forte que la marine allemande (« Kriegsmarine ») et aurait pu détruire toute flotte d'invasion envoyée à travers la Manche anglaise.
reference: But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel.
translation: French: Mais la Royal Navy était encore beaucoup plus forte que la marine allemande (« Kriegsmarine ») et aurait pu détruire toute flotte d'invasion envoyée à travers la Manche anglaise.

source: Cependant, très peu de navires de la Royal Navy étaient basés près des routes d'invasion probables car les amiraux craignaient d'être coulés par une attaque aérienne allemande.
reference: However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.
translation: However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the invasion routes as the admirals were afraid of being sunk by German air attack.

source: Commençons par expliquer la stratégie de l'Italie, « dauphin » principal de l'Allemagne et du Japon.
reference: Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the "little brother" of Germany and Japan.
translation: French text: Let's start with explaining Italy's strategy, "the main dauphin" of Germany and Japan.

source: Leur armée et leur flotte étaient plus faibles, et ce malgré le fait qu’ils aient construit quatre nouveaux navires juste avant le début de la guerre.
reference: It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war.
translation: French text: Their army and navy were weaker, despite having just built four new ships just before the beginning of the war.

source: Les principaux objectifs de l'Italie étaient les pays africains. Pour conquérir ces pays, il fallait disposer d'une base de lancement des troupes, afin que celles-ci puissent traverser la Méditerranée et envahir l'Afrique.
reference: Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa.
translation: French text: Italy's main objectives were African countries. To conquer these countries, they needed a launching pad for their troops, so that they could cross the Mediterranean and invade Africa.

source: Pour cela, ils devaient se débarrasser des bases et des navires britanniques en Égypte. En dehors de ces actions, les cuirassés italiens n'étaient pas censés faire quoi que ce soit d'autre.
reference: For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else.
translation: For this, they had to get rid of the bases and ships of the British in Egypt. Apart from these actions, the Italian cruisers were not supposed to do anything else.

source: Passons maintenant au Japon. Le Japon est un pays insulaire, tout comme la Grande-Bretagne.
reference: Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain.
translation: Now, let's move to Japan. Japan is an island country, just like Britain.

source: Les sous-marins sont des navires conçus pour voyager sous l'eau et y rester pendant une longue période.
reference: Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater, and remain there for an extended amount of time.
translation: Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater and remain there for a long time.

source: Les sous-marins ont été utilisés pendant la Première et la Deuxième Guerre mondiale. À l’époque, ils étaient très lents et avaient une portée de tir très limitée.
reference: Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. Back then they were very slow and had a very limited shooting range.
translation: French text: Submarines were used during World War I and World War II. At the time, they were very slow and had a very limited shooting range.

source: Au début de la guerre, ils voguaient essentiellement sur la mer. Mais au vu des progrès réalisés en matière de radars, et étant donné leur précision sans cesse grandissante, les sous-marins étaient obligé de passer sous l'eau pour ne pas être repérés.
reference: In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen.
translation: French text: At the beginning of the war, they mostly travelled on the sea. But as radar technology developed and became more accurate, submarines were forced to go underwater to avoid being spotted.

source: Les sous-marins allemands étaient appelés U-Boot. Les Allemands étaient très doués pour la navigation et le maniement de leurs sous-marins.
reference: German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and operating their submarines.
translation: French text: German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and operating their submarines.

source: En raison de leur succès avec les sous-marins, après la guerre on ne fait pas confiance aux Allemands pour qu'ils en possèdent beaucoup.
reference: Because of their success with submarines, after the war Germans aren't trusted to have many of them.
translation: French text: Due to their success with submarines, after the war Germans aren't trusted to have many.

source: Oui ! Le roi Toutankhamon, parfois appelé « Roi Tout » ou « L’Enfant roi », est l’un des anciens monarques égyptiens les plus connus des temps modernes.
reference: Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as "King Tut" or "The Boy King", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times.
translation: Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes called "King Tut" or "The Boy King", is one of the most famous ancient Egyptian kings of modern times.

source: Il est intéressant de noter qu’il n’était pas considéré comme très important dans l’Antiquité et n’était pas inscrit sur la plupart des anciennes listes de rois.
reference: Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists.
translation: It is interesting to note that he was not considered very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists.

source: Cependant, la découverte de sa tombe en 1922 a fait de lui une célébrité. Alors que de nombreuses tombes du passé ont été pillées, cette tombe est restée pratiquement intacte.
reference: However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed.
translation: However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs in the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually untouched.

source: La plupart des objets enterrés avec Toutankhamon ont été bien conservés, y compris des milliers d'artefacts faits de métaux précieux et de pierres rares.
reference: Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones.
translation: French text: Most of the objects buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made of precious metals and rare stones.

source: L'invention des roues à rayons a rendu les chars assyriens plus légers, plus rapides et mieux préparés pour distancer les soldats et autres chars.
reference: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots.
translation: French text: The invention of the axle wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots.

source: Les flèches de leurs arbalètes mortelles pouvaient pénétrer l'armure des soldats rivaux. Vers 1000 avant J.-C., les Assyriens ont introduit la première cavalerie.
reference: Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry.
translation: French text: Their deadly arrows could penetrate the armor of their enemies. Around 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry.

source: Une cavalerie est une armée qui combat à cheval. La selle n'ayant pas encore été inventée, la cavalerie assyrienne se battait en montant à cru.
reference: A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.
translation: French text: A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on horseback.

source: Nous connaissons de nombreux hommes politiques, scientifiques et artistes grecs. Mais le plus célèbre de toute cette civilisation est probablement Homère, le poète aveugle auteur des deux plus grands chefs-d'œuvre de la littérature grecque : les poèmes de l'Iliade et l'Odyssée.
reference: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey.
translation: Greek text: We know many Greek politicians, scientists and artists. But the most famous of all this civilization is probably Homer, the blind poet who wrote the two greatest Greek works of literature: the poems of Iliad and Odyssey.

source: Sophocle et Aristophane sont toujours des dramaturges populaires, et leurs pièces sont considérées comme faisant partie des plus grandes œuvres de la littérature mondiale.
reference: Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature.
translation: French text: Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights, and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature.

source: Un autre grec célèbre est le mathématicien Pythagore, surtout connu pour son célèbre théorème sur les relations des côtés des triangles rectangles.
reference: Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.
translation: Greek text: Another famous Greek is the mathematician Pythagoras, especially known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.

source: Les estimations sont variées quant au nombre de personnes qui parlent Hindi. On estime que c'est entre la deuxième et la quatrième langue la plus communément parlée au monde.
reference: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world.
translation: French: Les estimations varient quant au nombre de personnes qui parlent Hindi. On estime que c'est entre la deuxième et la quatrième langue la plus communément parlée au monde.

source: Le nombre de langues maternelles dépend de si oui ou non les dialectes très proches sont pris en compte.
reference: The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted.
translation: French text: The number of native languages depends on whether or not closely related dialects are counted.

source: Les estimations varient de 340 millions à 500 millions de locuteurs, et jusqu'à 800 millions de personnes peuvent comprendre la langue.
reference: Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language.
translation: French text: Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and up to 800 million people can understand the language.

source: L'hindi et l'ourdou disposent d'un vocabulaire semblable mais d'une écriture différente ; lors d'une conversation de tous les jours, les locuteurs des deux langues peuvent en général se comprendre.
reference: Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.
translation: French text: Hindi and urdu have similar vocabulary but different writing; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

source: Vers le 15e siècle, le nord de l’Estonie subissait une forte influence culturelle germanique.
reference: Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany.
translation: French text: Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under strong cultural influence from Germany.

source: Certains moines allemands voulaient rapprocher Dieu des autochtones ; c’est pour cela qu’ils ont inventé la langue littérale estonienne.
reference: Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language.
translation: French text: Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented Estonian literal language.

source: Il était basé sur l'alphabet allemand et un caractère « Õ/õ » a été ajouté.
reference: It was based on the German alphabet and one character "Õ/õ" was added.
translation: The French text was based on the German alphabet and one character "Õ/õ" was added.

source: Au fil du temps, de nombreux mots empruntés à l'allemand se sont mélangés. Ce fut le début du développement.
reference: As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment.
translation: French text: Over time, many words borrowed from German merged. This was the beginning of development.

source: Dans la tradition, l'héritier du trône faisait son service militaire après avoir fini ses études.
reference: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school.
translation: Tradition: In the tradition, the heir to the throne would serve in the army after finishing his education.

source: Cependant, Charles est allé à l’université au Trinity College, à Cambridge, où il a étudié l’anthropologie et l’archéologie, et plus tard, l’histoire, obtenant un 2:2 (un diplôme inférieur de deuxième classe).
reference: However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree).
translation: However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge, where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree).

source: Charles fut le premier membre de la famille royale britannique à obtenir une licence.
reference: Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.
translation: Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to get a degree.

source: La Turquie européenne (Thrace orientale ou Roumélie dans la péninsule balkanique) comprend 3 % du pays.
reference: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country.
translation: Turkish Europe (Thrace or Roumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country.

source: Le territoire de la Turquie est long de plus de 1600 kilomètres (1000 miles) et large de 800 kilomètres (500 miles), avec une forme plus ou moins rectangulaire.
reference: The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape.
translation: Turkish territory is over 1600 kilometers (1000 miles) long and 800 kilometers (500 miles) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape.

source: La superficie de la Turquie, lacs compris, est de 783 562 kilomètres carrés, dont 755 688 kilomètres carrés en Asie du Sud-Ouest et 23 764 kilomètres carrés en Europe.
reference: Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe.
translation: Turkish area: The surface of Turkey, including lakes, is 783,562 square kilometers, of which 755,688 square kilometers are in the Southwest Asia and 23,764 square kilometers in Europe.

source: La superficie de la Turquie en fait le 37e plus grand pays du monde et équivaut à peu près à la taille de la France métropolitaine et du Royaume-Uni réunis.
reference: Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined.
translation: Turkish surface area makes Turkey the 37th largest country in the world, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined.

source: La Turquie est entourée par des mers sur trois côtés : la mer Égée à l'ouest, la mer Noire au nord et la mer Méditerranée au sud.
reference: Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.
translation: Turkey is surrounded by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

source: Le Luxembourg a une longue histoire, mais son indépendance ne date que de 1839.
reference: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839.
translation: Luxembourg has a long history, but its independence dates from 1839.

source: Certaines régions actuelles de la Belgique faisaient autrefois partie du Luxembourg, mais sont devenues belges après la Révolution belge des années 1830.
reference: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
translation: French text: Some parts of Belgium today were once part of Luxembourg, but became Belgian after the 1830 Belgian Revolution.

source: Le Luxembourg a toujours essayé de rester un pays neutre, mais le territoire a été occupé par l’Allemagne pendant les Première et Seconde Guerres mondiales.
reference: Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany.
translation: Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country, but the territory was occupied by Germany during World War I and World War II.

source: En 1957, le Luxembourg est devenu l'un des membres fondateurs de l'organisme aujourd'hui connu sous le nom d'Union Européenne.
reference: In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.
translation: 1957: Luxembourg became one of the founding members of the organization today known as the European Union.

source: Le Drukgyal Dzong est une forteresse et un monastère bouddhiste en ruine dans la partie supérieure du district de Paro (dans le village de Phondey).
reference: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village).
translation: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined Buddhist fortress and monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village).

source: On dit qu’en 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel a créé la forteresse pour commémorer sa victoire sur les forces tibéto-mongoles.
reference: It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces.
translation: French text: According to legend, in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel built the fortress to commemorate his victory against Tibetan-Mongol forces.

source: En 1951, un incendie a fait qu’il ne reste que quelques reliques des Drukgyal Dzong, comme l’image de Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal.
reference: In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal.
translation: French text: In 1951, an fire destroyed the Drukgyal Dzong, leaving only a few remnants, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal.

source: Après l'incendie, la forteresse a été préservée et protégée, restant l'une des attractions les plus sensationnelles du Bhoutan.
reference: After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.
translation: After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

source: Au XVIIIe siècle, le Cambodge s'est retrouvé coincé entre deux puissants voisins, la Thaïlande et le Vietnam.
reference: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam.
translation: 18th century: Cambodia was caught between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam.

source: Les Thaïs ont envahi le Cambodge à plusieurs reprises au XVIIIe siècle et en 1772, ils ont détruit Phnom Phen.
reference: The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen.
translation: French text: The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen.

source: À la fin du XVIIIe siècle, les Vietnamiens envahirent aussi le Cambodge.
reference: In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.
translation: French text: In the 18th century, the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

source: Dix-huit pour cent des Vénézuéliens sont au chômage, et la plupart de ceux qui ont un emploi travaillent dans l'économie informelle.
reference: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy.
translation: French text: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy.

source: Deux tiers des Vénézuéliens qui travaillent le font dans le secteur des services, près d’un quart dans l’industrie et un cinquième dans l’agriculture.
reference: Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture.
translation: French text: Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, one fourth in industry and a fifth in agriculture.

source: Une industrie importante pour les Vénézuéliens est le pétrole, dont le pays est un exportateur net, même si seulement un pour cent travaille dans l’industrie pétrolière.
reference: An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.
translation: French text: Venezuela is an important oil producer, and the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

source: Au lendemain de son indépendance, Singapour a acquis une expertise dans le domaine des jardins botaniques. Cet Etat insulaire s'est par la suite transformé en une cité jardin de type tropical.
reference: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City.
translation: French text: After its independence, Singapore acquired expertise in the field of botanical gardens. This island state became a tropical garden city.

source: En 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, un hybride d'orchidée, a été choisie comme fleur emblème de la nation.
reference: In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.
translation: 1981: Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

source: Chaque année, vers le mois d’octobre, près de 1,5 million d’herbivores se dirigent vers les plaines du sud, en traversant la rivière Mara, depuis les collines du nord pour les pluies.
reference: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains.
translation: French text: Every year, in October, about 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the plains of the south, crossing the Mara river, from the north hills for the rains.

source: Et puis retour au nord par l'ouest, en traversant une fois de plus la rivière Mara, après les pluies aux environs d'avril.
reference: And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April.
translation: French text: And then back to the north by the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in April.

source: La région du Serengeti comprend le parc national du Serengeti, la zone de conservation de Ngorongoro et la réserve de chasse des Maswa en Tanzanie, ainsi que la réserve nationale du Masai Mara au Kenya.
reference: The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.
translation: The Serengeti region includes the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania, and the Masai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

source: Apprendre à créer des médias interactifs nécessite des compétences conventionnelles et traditionnelles, ainsi que des outils maîtrisés dans le cadre de cours interactifs (storyboarding, montage audio et vidéo, narration d'histoires, etc.)
reference: Learning to create interactive media requires conventional and traditional skills, as well as tools mastered in interactive classes (storyboarding, audio and video editing, story telling, etc.)
translation: French text: Learning to create interactive media requires conventional and traditional skills, as well as tools mastered in interactive classes (storyboarding, audio and video editing, story telling, etc.)

source: La conception interactive vous oblige à remettre en question votre perception de la production de médias et à apprendre à penser de façon non linéaire.
reference: Interactive design requires that you re-assess your assumptions about media production and learn to think in a non-linear ways.
translation: French text: Interactive design requires you to question your perception of media production and to learn to think in a non-linear way.

source: Le design interactif exige que les éléments d'un projet soient reliés entre eux, mais également qu'ils aient un sens en tant qu'entité indépendante.
reference: Interactive design requires that components of a project connect to each other, but also make sense as a separate entity.
translation: French text: Interactive design requires that elements of a project are connected, but also that they have meaning as an independent entity.

source: Les lentilles de l'objectif zoom présentent un inconvénient. En effet, la complexité de la focale et le nombre de lentilles requis pour obtenir une gamme de longueurs focales sont largement supérieurs à ceux des objectifs fixes.
reference: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses.
translation: French text: The zoom lens has a disadvantage. The complexity of the focal length and the number of lenses required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than that of a fixed lens.

source: Cela devient moins problématique à mesure que les fabricants de lentilles atteignent des normes plus élevées dans la production de lentilles.
reference: This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production.
translation: French text: This becomes less of a problem as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production.

source: Cela a permis aux zooms de produire des images d'une qualité comparable à celle obtenue par des objectifs à longueur focale fixe.
reference: This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length.
translation: The French translation: This allowed zoom lenses to produce images of a quality comparable to that achieved by fixed focal length lenses.

source: Un autre inconvénient des objectifs zooms est que l’ouverture (la vitesse) maximale de l’objectif est généralement plus faible.
reference: Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower.
translation: French text: Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower.

source: Cela rend les objectifs zoom peu coûteux difficiles à utiliser dans des conditions de faible luminosité sans flash.
reference: This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.
translation: French text: This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without flash.

source: L'un des problèmes les plus courants lors de la conversion d'un film en format DVD est le surbalayage.
reference: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan.
translation: French text: One of the most common problems when converting a film to DVD format is overscan.

source: La plupart des télévisions sont fabriquées de manière à plaire au grand public.
reference: Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public.
translation: French text: Most televisions are made to please the general public.

source: Pour cette raison, tout ce que vous visionnez sur télévision a les bords coupés en haut, en bas et sur les côtés.
reference: For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides.
translation: French text: For this reason, everything you watch on television has borders cut at the top, bottom and sides.

source: Il faut donc veiller à ce que l'image couvre tout l'écran. C'est ce qu'on appelle l'overscan.
reference: This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan.
translation: French text: So, it is important to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. This is called overscan.

source: Malheureusement, lorsque vous réalisez un DVD, ses bords seront probablement coupés aussi, et si la vidéo comportait des sous-titres trop proches du bas de l'écran, ils n'apparaîtront pas.
reference: Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.
translation: French text: Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, its borders will probably be cut too, and if the video contained subtitles too close to the bottom of the screen, they won't appear.

source: Le château médiéval traditionnel a longtemps stimulé l'imagination, évoquant des images de joutes, de banquets et de chevalerie arthurienne.
reference: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry.
translation: French text: The medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry.

source: Même au milieu de ruines millénaires, il est facile de se rappeler les bruits et les odeurs de batailles lointaines, d'entendre presque le cliquetis des sabots sur les pavés et de sentir la peur monter des fosses du donjon.
reference: Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits.
translation: French text: Even in the midst of the thousand year old ruins, it is easy to remember the sounds and smells of distant battles, to hear the clatter of hooves on the pavement and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits.

source: Mais notre imagination est-elle basée sur la réalité ? Pourquoi a-t-on construit des châteaux en premier lieu ? Comment ont-ils été conçus et construits ?
reference: But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
translation: French text: But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

source: Typique de l'époque, le château de Kirby Muxloe relève plus d'une maison fortifiée que d'un véritable château.
reference: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle.
translation: Typical of the time, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle.

source: Ses baies fenêtres vitrées et ses minces parois n'auraient pas pu résister longtemps à un assaut acharné.
reference: Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long.
translation: French text: Its narrow windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack.

source: Dans les années 1480, lorsque sa construction fut lancée par Lord Hastings, le pays était relativement paisible et la défense n’était nécessaire que contre de petites bandes de maraudeurs itinérants.
reference: In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.
translation: French text: In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

source: L'équilibre des pouvoirs était un système dans lequel les nations européennes cherchaient à maintenir la souveraineté nationale de tous les États européens.
reference: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states.
translation: French text: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain national sovereignty of all European states.

source: L'idée était que toutes les nations européennes empêchent une nation de devenir puissante, c'est pourquoi les gouvernements nationaux changeaient souvent d'alliances afin de maintenir l'équilibre.
reference: The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance.
translation: The French text is that all European nations prevented one nation from becoming powerful, so that national governments often changed alliances to maintain balance.

source: La Guerre de Succession d’Espagne marqua la Première Guerre dont l’issue principale fut l’équilibre des pouvoirs.
reference: The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power.
translation: French text: The Spanish Succession War marked the first war whose outcome was the balance of power.

source: Cela a marqué un changement important, car les puissances européennes ne pourraient plus utiliser le prétexte des guerres de religion. Ainsi, la guerre de Trente Ans serait la dernière guerre à être qualifiée de guerre de religion.
reference: This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.
translation: French text: This marked a significant change, as European powers would no longer use the pretext of religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

source: Le temple d'Artémis à Ephèse a été détruit le 21 juillet 356 avant J.-C. lors d'un incendie criminel commis par Herostratus.
reference: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus.
translation: French text: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE by Herostratus.

source: D'après l'histoire, sa motivation était la célébrité à tout prix. Les Ephésiens, indignés, annoncent que le nom d'Herostratus ne sera jamais enregistré.
reference: According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded.
translation: French text: According to the story, his motivation was fame at all costs. The Ephesians, indignant, announced that the name of Herostratus would never be recorded.

source: L'historien grec Strabo mentionna ce nom plus tard et c'est ainsi qu'il nous est parvenu. Le temple fut détruit la même nuit qui vit la naissance d'Alexandre le Grand.
reference: The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born.
translation: Greek text: The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name and that is how we know it today. The temple was destroyed the same night that Alexander the Great was born.

source: Alexandre, en tant que roi, offrit de payer pour reconstruire le temple, mais son offre fut déclinée. Plus tard, après la mort d’Alexandre, le temple fut reconstruit en 323 avant notre ère.
reference: Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.
translation: French text: Alexandre, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was turned down. Later, after Alexander's death, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.

source: Vérifiez que votre main soit détendue le plus possible lorsque vous jouez chaque note  correctement. Essayez également de ne pas faire de mouvements inutiles avec vos doigts.
reference: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers.
translation: Note: Make sure your hand is relaxed as much as possible when playing each note correctly. Also try not to make unnecessary movements with your fingers.

source: Vous vous fatigueriez moins de cette façon. N'oubliez pas qu'il n'est pas nécessaire de trop insister sur les touches pour qu'elles résonnent plus fort. C'est le cas sur le piano.
reference: This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano.
translation: French text: You would tire yourself out less of this way. Don't forget that keys need not be pressed too hard to make them sound louder. This is the case on the piano.

source: Avec l'accordéon, pour produire plus de volume, actionnez le soufflet en augmentant la pression ou la vitesse des mouvements.
reference: On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.
translation: French text: With the accordion, to produce more volume, increase the pressure or speed of the movements.

source: Le mysticisme est la recherche de la communion, du lien avec une divinité ou d'un dieu. C'est la pleine conscience d'une vérité spirituelle.
reference: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God.
translation: French text: Mysticism is the search for communion, for a link with a divinity or a god. It is the full awareness of a spiritual truth.

source: Le croyant recherche une expérience directe, une intuition ou une révélation de la réalité divine/de la divinité ou des dieux.
reference: The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties.
translation: French text: The believer seeks direct experience, intuition, or revelation of divine reality/deity or gods.

source: Les adeptes poursuivent certains modes de vie, ou des pratiques qui visent à nourrir ces expériences.
reference: Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences.
translation: French text: Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that feed those experiences.

source: Le mysticisme peut être distingué des autres formes de culte et de croyance à caractère religieux par son accent sur l'expérience personnelle directe d'un état unique de conscience, notamment dans le cas d'une personnalité paisible, intuitive, heureuse, voire extatique.
reference: Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.
translation: French text: Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly in the case of a peaceful, intuitive, happy, or ecstatic personality.

source: Le sikhisme est une religion du sous-continent indien, née au XVe siècle dans la région du Pendjab, à la suite d’un schisme au sein de la tradition hindouiste.
reference: Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition.
translation: Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent, which originated in the 15th century in the region of Punjab, from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition.

source: Les sikhs considèrent que leur foi est une religion distincte de l'hindouisme, bien qu'ils reconnaissent ses racines et ses traditions hindoues.
reference: Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions.
translation: The Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism, though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions.

source: Les sikhs appellent leur religion Gurmat, ce qui signifie « voie du gourou » en pendjabi. Le gourou est un aspect fondamental de toutes les religions indiennes, mais dans le sikhisme, il a pris une importance qui forme le noyau des croyances sikhes.
reference: Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for "way of the guru". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs.
translation: Punjabi text: Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which means "the way of the guru" in Punjabi. The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions, but in Sikhism, he has taken on a significance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs.

source: La religion a été fondée au XVe siècle par le gourou Nanak (1469-1539). Neuf autres gourous se sont succédés.
reference: The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus.
translation: The religion was founded in the 15th century by the gourou Nanak (1469-1539). Nine other gourous followed him.

source: Cependant, en juin 1956, les promesses de Khrouchtchev ont été mises à l'épreuve lorsque les émeutes en Pologne, où les travailleurs protestaient contre les pénuries alimentaires et les réductions de salaires, se sont transformées en une protestation générale contre le communisme.
reference: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism.
translation: However, in June 1956, Khrushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against communism.

source: Bien qu’en fin de compte, Kroutchev ait envoyé des chars pour rétablir l’ordre, il a cédé à certaines exigences économiques et a accepté de nommer le populaire Wladyslaw Gomulka comme nouveau premier ministre.
reference: Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.
translation: French text: Although in the end, Kroutchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to name popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

source: La civilisation de la vallée de l'Indus est une civilisation de l'âge de bronze du sous-continent indien du nord-ouest, qui englobe la plus grande partie du Pakistan actuel et certaines régions du nord-ouest de l'Inde et du nord-est de l'Afghanistan.
reference: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan.
translation: The Indus Valley Civilization is a Bronze Age civilisation of the northwest Indian subcontinent, which includes most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions of northwest India and northeast Afghanistan.

source: Cette civilisation a prospéré dans les bassins de l’Indus, d’où son nom.
reference: The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name.
translation: The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River, hence its name.

source: Certains universitaires soutiennent néanmoins qu'étant donné que cette civilisation était également présente dans les bassins du fleuve Sarasvati aujourd'hui asséché, elle devrait justement être appelée la civilisation de l'Indus-Sarasvati, alors que certains la nomment civilisation Harappan d'après Harappa, le premier de ses sites à avoir été mis au jour, dans les années 1920.
reference: Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.
translation: French text: Some scholars, however, argue that since this civilisation was also present in the basins of the now dried Sarasvati River, it should be called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while others call it Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.

source: La nature militariste de l’empire romain a contribué au développement des progrès de la médecine.
reference: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances.
translation: French text: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire contributed to the development of medical advances.

source: L'empereur Auguste entreprit de recruter des médecins et forma même le premier corps médical romain chargé de soigner les victimes des batailles.
reference: Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles.
translation: French text: Emperor Augustus started to recruit doctors and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps to treat the wounded from battles.

source: Les chirurgiens connaissaient divers sédatifs comme la morphine, ce produit tirée des graines de pavot ainsi que la scopolamine, extraite de graines de jusquiame noire.
reference: Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds.
translation: French text: The surgeons knew of various sedatives such as morphine, a product derived from poppy seeds, and scopolamine, derived from juniper seeds.

source: Ils devinrent des experts de l’amputation en sauvant des patients de la gangrène, ainsi qu’en matière de pinces à ligature et de pinces artérielles servant à juguler le flux sanguin.
reference: They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow.
translation: French text: They became experts in amputations, saving patients from gangrene, as well as in arterial clamps and tourniquets to control blood flow.

source: À travers les siècles, l'empire romain a grandement œuvré dans le domaine de la médecine, et est à l'origine de la plupart des connaissances que nous possédons aujourd'hui.
reference: Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.
translation: French text: Through the centuries, the Roman empire has greatly contributed to the development of medicine, and is to this day responsible for most of the knowledge we have today.

source: L'origami Pureland est un origami avec la contrainte qu'un seul pli peut être fait à la fois, les plis plus complexes comme les plis inversés ne sont pas autorisés, et tous les plis ont des emplacements simples.
reference: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations.
translation: Pureland Origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold can be made at a time, more complex folds such as reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have simple locations.

source: Il a été développé par John Smith dans les années 1970 pour aider les personnes inexpérimentées ou ayant des capacités motrices limitées.
reference: It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.
translation: The French text: It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced or limited motor abilities.

source: Les enfants prennent très tôt conscience de la notion de race et des stéréotypes raciaux, et ces stéréotypes ont une incidence sur le comportement.
reference: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior.
translation: French: Les enfants prennent très tôt conscience de la notion de race et des stéréotypes raciaux, et ces stéréotypes ont une incidence sur le comportement.

source: Par exemple, les enfants qui s'identifient à une minorité raciale perçue habituellement comme peu performante à l'école ont tendance à échouer à l'école dès qu'ils découvrent le stéréotype associé à leur race.
reference: For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.
translation: For example, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not performing well in school tend to fail to school once they discover the stereotype associated with their race.

source: MySpace est le troisième site Internet le plus populaire utilisé aux États-Unis et compte actuellement 54 millions de profils.
reference: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently.
translation: French text: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently.

source: Ces sites Web ont suscité un grand intéret, surtout le volet éducation.
reference: These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting.
translation: French text: These websites have received a great deal of attention, especially in the education sector.

source: Ces sites ont des côtés bénéfiques, y compris de pouvoir facilement mettre en place des types de page qui comprennent des blogs, des vidéos, des photos, et d'autres fonctionnalités.
reference: There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features.
translation: French text: These sites have positive aspects, including being able to easily set up types of pages that include blogs, videos, photos, and other features.

source: Cette page est accessible facilement à partir d'une seule adresse Web, ce qui la rend facile à mémoriser et à écrire pour les étudiants qui ne savent pas utiliser un clavier et qui ont des problèmes d'orthographe.
reference: This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling.
translation: French text: This page is easily accessible from a single web address, which makes it easy to remember and write for students who don't know how to use a keyboard and have problems with spelling.

source: Elle peut être personnalisée afin d'en faciliter la lecture, et l'on peut y mettre autant ou aussi peu de couleur que l'on souhaite.
reference: It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.
translation: French text: It can be customized to make it easier to read, and it can be colored as much or as little as desired.

source: Le trouble déficitaire de l'attention « est un syndrome neurologique dont les trois symptômes caractéristiques sont l'impulsivité, la difficulté à se concentrer et l'hyperactivité (ou excès d'énergie) ».
reference: Attention Deficit Disorder "is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy".
translation: French text: Attention Deficit Disorder "is a neurological syndrome whose three defining symptoms are impulsivity, difficulty concentrating, and hyperactivity (or excess energy)"

source: Ce n'est pas un handicap d'apprentissage. C'est un trouble de l'apprentissage qui affecte 3 à 5 % des enfants et concerne près de 2 millions d'enfants américains.
reference: It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it "affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children".
translation: French text: This is not a learning disability. It's a learning disorder that affects 3 to 5% of children, and affects nearly 2 million American children.

source: Les enfants atteints de TDA ont du mal à se concentrer sur des choses telles que les travaux scolaires, mais ils peuvent se concentrer sur ce qu'ils aiment faire, comme jouer à des jeux ou regarder leurs dessins animés préférés ou écrire des phrases sans ponctuation.
reference: Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation.
translation: French: Les enfants atteints de TDA ont du mal à se concentrer sur des choses telles que les travaux scolaires, mais ils peuvent se concentrer sur ce qu'ils aiment faire, comme jouer à des jeux ou regarder leurs dessins animés préférés ou écrire des phrases sans ponctuation.

source: Ce sont des enfants qui ont tendance à avoir des difficultés importantes, car ils « adoptent des comportements à risque, se battent et défient l'autorité » afin de stimuler leur cerveau, puisque celui-ci ne peut être stimulé par des activités normales.
reference: These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they "engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods.
translation: French text: These children tend to have difficulty in school because they "engage in risky behaviors, fight, and challenge authority" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain cannot be stimulated by normal activities.

source: Le TDA affecte les relations avec les autres enfants, qui ne peuvent pas comprendre pourquoi les malades agissent de la sorte, pourquoi ils épellent comme ils le font, ou pourquoi leur niveau de maturité est différent.
reference: ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different.
translation: French text: The TDA affects relationships with other children, who cannot understand why the children behave the way they do, why they spell the way they do, or why their maturity level is different.

source: Comme la capacité à acquérir la connaissance et à apprendre a changé d'une certaine façon telle que mentionnée ci-dessus, le rythme de base auquel la connaissance s'acquérait a changé.
reference: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed.
translation: French text: As the ability to acquire knowledge and learn has changed in a certain way as mentioned above, the basic rate at which knowledge is acquired has changed.

source: La manière de récupérer l'information était différente. Il n'y avait plus de pression sur la mémoire individuelle, mais la capacité à se souvenir d'un texte devenait plus importante.
reference: The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus.
translation: French text: The way to get information was different. There was no pressure on individual memory, but the ability to remember a text became more important.

source: En somme, la Renaissance a été à l'origine d'un changement majeur dans la façon d'envisager l'apprentissage et la diffusion des connaissances.
reference: In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.
translation: In short, the Renaissance led to a major change in the way knowledge was learned and disseminated.

source: Les hominidés n'utilisent plus leurs mains pour marcher, porter des charges lourdes ou se balancer d'une branche à l'autre d'un arbre comme les autres primates.
reference: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees.
translation: French: Les hominidés ne marchent plus avec leurs mains, ne portent plus de charges lourdes ou ne se balancent plus d'une branche à l'autre d'un arbre comme les autres primates.

source: La main et le pied du chimpanzé sont similaires en taille et en longueur, ce qui reflète l'utilisation de la main pour porter le poids dans la locomotion sur les articulations.
reference: The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking.
translation: French text: The hand and foot of the chimpanzé are similar in size and length, which reflects the use of the hand to carry weight in locomotion on the joints.

source: La main de l'homme est plus courte que son pied, avec des phalanges plus rigides.
reference: The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges.
translation: French text: The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges.

source: Les os de la main d'un fossile, vieux de deux à trois millions d'années, révèlent la mutation qu'a subit la fonction de la main lors du passage de la locomotion à la manipulation.
reference: Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.
translation: French text: Fossil hand bones, two to three million years old, reveal the mutation that took place in the hand's function during the transition from locomotion to manipulation.

source: Certaines personnes pensent que faire de nombreux rêves lucides provoqués artificiellement et assez souvent peut être très épuisant.
reference: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting.
translation: French text: Some people think that having a lot of lucid dreams induced artificially and often can be very exhausting.

source: La raison principale de ce phénomène est le résultat des rêves lucides qui allongent la durée entre les états de sommeil paradoxal.
reference: The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states.
translation: The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of lucid dreaming which lengthens the time between REM states.

source: Avec moins de sommeil paradoxal par nuit, cet état dans lequel vous profitez d'un vrai sommeil réparateur devient suffisamment rare pour devenir problématique.
reference: With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem.
translation: French text: With less REM sleep per night, this state in which you experience a real restful sleep becomes sufficiently rare to become a problem.

source: C’est tout aussi épuisant que de se réveiller toutes les vingt ou trente minutes et de regarder la télévision.
reference: This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV.
translation: French text: This is just as exhausting as having to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV.

source: L’effet dépend de la fréquence à laquelle votre cerveau tente de rêver lucidement par nuit.
reference: The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.
translation: French text: The effect depends on how often your brain attempts lucid dreaming per night.

source: Les choses prirent une mauvaise tournure pour les Italiens en Afrique du Nord quasiment dès le début. Une semaine après la déclaration de guerre de l’Italie le 10 juin 1940, les 11e hussards britanniques s’emparèrent du Fort Capuzzo en Libye.
reference: Things did not go well for the Italians in North Africa almost from the start. Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars had seized Fort Capuzzo in Libya.
translation: French text: Things went wrong for the Italians in North Africa almost from the start. A week after Italy declared war on Germany on June 10, 1940, British 11th Hussars seized Fort Capuzzo in Libya.

source: Dans une embuscade à l'est de Bardia, les Britanniques ont capturé l'ingénieur en chef de la dixième armée italienne, le général Lastucci.
reference: In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Tenth Army's Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci.
translation: French text: In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci.

source: Le 28 juin, le maréchal Italo Balbo, gouverneur général de Libye et successeur potentiel de Mussolini, fut tué par un tir ami alors qu'il atterrissait à Tobrouk.
reference: On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, the Governor-General of Libya and apparent heir to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.
translation: 28 June: Marshal Italo Balbo, the Governor-General of Libya and a potential successor to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.

source: Le sport moderne qu'est l'escrime se pratique à de nombreux niveaux, depuis les étudiants qui en font l'apprentissage à l'université jusqu'aux compétitions professionnelles et olympiques.
reference: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition.
translation: French text: Modern sport of swordsmanship is practiced at many levels, from students learning at university to professional and Olympic competitions.

source: Ce sport se pratique principalement dans un format de duel, un escrimeur se battant contre un autre.
reference: The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.
translation: French text: This sport is primarily played in a duel format, a wrestler fighting another.

source: Le golf est un jeu dans lequel les joueurs utilisent des clubs pour frapper des balles et les envoyer dans des trous.
reference: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes.
translation: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls and put them into holes.

source: Une partie se joue ordinairement en dix-huit trous : les joueurs commencent en règle générale par le premier trou du parcours et terminent par le dix-huitième.
reference: Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth.
translation: French text: A round of golf is usually played in eighteen holes: the players usually start at the first hole on the course and finish at the eighteenth.

source: Le joueur qui encaisse le moins de coups, ou de swings avec le club, pour terminer le parcours gagne.
reference: The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins.
translation: The player who takes the fewest swings or shots to complete the course wins.

source: Le jeu se joue sur l'herbe, et le gazon qui entoure le trou est coupé plus court et appelé le « green ».
reference: The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.
translation: The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is cut shorter and called the "green."

source: Le type de tourisme le plus répandu est peut-être celui que la plupart des gens associent au voyage : Le tourisme récréatif.
reference: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism.
translation: French text: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism.

source: C'est le moment où les gens se rendent dans un endroit, complètement différent de ce qu'il voit au quotidien, pour se détendre et prendre du bon temps.
reference: This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun.
translation: French text: This is the time when people go to a place completely different from their normal life to relax and have fun.

source: Les plages, les parcs à thème et les terrains de camping sont souvent les lieux les plus fréquentés par les touristes de loisirs.
reference: Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists.
translation: French text: Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most popular places frequented by recreational tourists.

source: Si l'objectif de la visite d'un lieu particulier est de connaître son histoire et sa culture, ce type de tourisme s'appelle alors tourisme culturel.
reference: If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism.
translation: French text: If the purpose of one’s visit to a particular place is to learn about its history and culture, this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism.
